name: UITabBar
desc: A control that displays one or more buttons in a tab bar for selecting between different subtasks, views, or modes in an app.

items.name: protocol UITabBarDelegate
items.desc: The UITabBarDelegate protocol defines optional methods for a delegate of a UITabBar object. The UITabBar class provides the ability for the user to reorder, remove, and add items to the tab bar; this process is referred to as customizing the tab bar. The tab bar delegate receives messages when customizing occurs.

items.name: var items: [UITabBarItem]?
items.desc: The items displayed by the tab bar.

items.name: func setItems([UITabBarItem]?, animated: Bool)
items.desc: Sets the items on the tab bar, optionally animating any changes into position.

items.name: var selectedItem: UITabBarItem?
items.desc: The currently selected item on the tab bar.

items.name: var standardAppearance: UITabBarAppearance
items.desc: The appearance settings for a standard-height tab bar.

items.name: var scrollEdgeAppearance: UITabBarAppearance?
items.desc: The appearance settings for the tab bar when the edge of scrollable content aligns with the edge of the tab bar.

items.name: var leadingAccessoryView: UIView
items.desc: The view at the leading edge of a tab bar on tvOS.

items.name: var trailingAccessoryView: UIView
items.desc: The view at the trailing edge of a tab bar on tvOS.

items.name: var isTranslucent: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the tab bar is translucent.

items.name: func beginCustomizingItems([UITabBarItem])
items.desc: Presents a standard interface that lets the user customize the contents of the tab bar.

items.name: func endCustomizing(animated: Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Dismisses the standard interface used to customize the tab bar.

items.name: var isCustomizing: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the user is currently customizing the tab bar.
